etymologies: 1970s (in the general sense of ‘a strict or demanding mother’): popularized as a specific concept by Amy Chua in the book Battle Hymn of the Tiger Mother (2011)

definitions: a strict or demanding mother who pushes her child or children to high levels of achievement, especially by using methods regarded as typical of childrearing in China and other parts of East Asia

examples.text: because of the number of classes her daughter attends, Lee says some people will think she's a tiger mother

shortDefinitions: strict or demanding mother who pushes children to high levels of achievement
